title: Ribosomal RNA promoter/TSS detection
description: This feature detects transcription start sites (TSS) or promoter regions, with particularly strong activation near ribosomal RNA genes and between coding sequences. The feature produces sharp, distinct activation spikes rather than broad regions of activation, suggesting it's identifying precise genomic positions where transcription begins. The pattern is highly consistent across diverse prokaryotic genomes, including both bacteria and archaea, indicating it's detecting a conserved genomic element fundamental to transcriptional regulation. In example 8, we see direct evidence of activation adjacent to ribosomal RNA genes, while other examples show activation at positions that likely correspond to promoters or regulatory elements between coding sequences. The conservation across diverse organisms suggests this feature captures a fundamental aspect of RNA polymerase binding sites or associated regulatory elements.
